examples: Maths error casts doubts on Greater Cambridge Partnership's road.
To raise doubts in people’s minds.
After a successful career at the Italian central bank, few people doubt his ability to whip the economy into shape.
A new study is casting doubt on the once popular narrative that N95 masks are more effective than surgical masks.
The referee gave him the benefit of the doubt.
words.defineEn: a feeling of uncertainty about something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác không chắc chắn về một cái gì đó

examples: Both teams chanced their arms at every opportunity.
Several chances came our way
The home side had a chance to take the lead.
I had the chance to taste mangosteen during my trip to Thailand.
Simon had an eye for the chance.
words.defineEn: a possibility that something will happen
words.defineVi: một khả năng rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: I absolutely love your shoes.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Jenny is absolutely cheesed off with her job.
He was said to be absolutely shattered after losing his job.
Those of you with clear consciences have absolutely nothing to fear.
words.defineEn: used to put an emphasis on a statement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh vào một tuyên bố

examples: We thought the world of our teacher, Mr. Johnson.
He thought like a general.
Many people thought that the Internet would toll the death knell for newspapers.
Politicians think they can easily lead people by the nose.
She really thinks on her feet well.
words.defineEn: to have a type of belief, idea, or opinion about a person or thing
words.defineVi: để có một loại niềm tin, ý tưởng, hoặc quan điểm về một người hoặc điều

examples: Jane sure ran a tight ship around here.
That player sure got the bird after he dropped the ball.
The boss sure aired his lungs when we lost another customer!
He felt sure about his answer during the exam.
You can be sure of that.
words.defineEn: feeling confident about something being correct or true
words.defineVi: cảm thấy tự tin về một cái gì đó là đúng hoặc đúng

examples: My best friend's pink hair definitely raised a few eyebrows at our very strict school.
I definitely felt the importance of the occasion.
You should definitely bake a brie with cranberry sauce.
Speaking that rudely to your teacher definitely crosses the line.
Going to the beach is definitely my scene.
words.defineEn: in a certain or definite way
words.defineVi: theo một cách nhất định hoặc xác định

examples: Perhaps it had something to do with their drink.
Perhaps we should consider the flip side of the coin : there should be no expenditure without representation.
I know there's a lot to discuss, but perhaps we should take a break for now.
The chances of Francis eventually becoming manager of England are perhaps higher.
Next week perhaps I’ll find myself wearing a different hat.
words.defineEn: used to express possibility or to show one's uncertainty about something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện khả năng hoặc để thể hiện sự không chắc chắn của một người về điều gì đó

examples: It is possible that parents have lost sight of their children as a result of their own problems.
It is possible to go without food for a few days.
Sorry, it's not possible to lend you my car.
The CEO is meeting her opposite number at Fukuda Electronics to discuss a possible joint venture.
I think it's possible to find a balance, you know?
words.defineEn: able to exist, happen, or be done
words.defineVi: có thể tồn tại, xảy ra, hoặc được thực hiện

examples: The board agreed to sell the company.
All ministers are agreed on the need to cut bureaucratic red tape.
Do you agree that the opposite side of the coin is too often untold?
The deal will be agreed on Wednesday, knock on wood.
Getting off his back would be nice for a change don't you agree?
words.defineEn: to hold the same opinion about something as that of another person
words.defineVi: để giữ quan điểm tương tự về một cái gì đó như của người khác

examples: We disagree on most things, but on this question we are at one.
The rest of you may disagree, but I, for one, think we should go ahead with the plan.
He tends to fly off the handle when people disagree with him.
Even if you disagree with someone, you should still lend them your ear and try to understand their point of view.
Scientists disagree about how the universe was created.
words.defineEn: to hold or give a different opinion about something
words.defineVi: để giữ hoặc đưa ra một ý kiến khác nhau về một cái gì đó

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
His new world record will take some beating.
The center will serve the whole community.
The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
A white blouse will show the blood.
words.defineEn: used to express what one deems true or probable
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện những gì một người cho là đúng hoặc có thể xảy ra

examples: I might be getting the flu.
"Yeah, and pigs might fly."
Yeah, and pigs might fly.
You might as well bring sand to the beach!
You might as well just quit.
words.defineEn: past of may, used in reported speech
words.defineVi: quá khứ của tháng năm, được sử dụng trong bài phát biểu báo cáo

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
You know, maybe that old guy was yanking our chain.
They've suffered a heart attack, maybe two.
If you're not prepared to handle the pressure, then maybe this job isn't for you.
Maybe I should take a leaf out of Rick's book and start coming in early every morning.
words.defineEn: used to show that you are uncertain about the occurrence, correctness, or truth of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng bạn không chắc chắn về sự xuất hiện, tính chính xác hoặc sự thật của một cái gì đó
